intro: Passerina stellera, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or white. The plant is native to North America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. Passerina stellera produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits to pollinators.
